trans-unit.source: Use Notification Hubs to send breaking news (Windows Universal)
trans-unit.target: Use Notification Hubs to send breaking news (Windows Universal)

trans-unit.source: Use Azure Notification Hubs with tags in the registration to send breaking news to a universal Windows app.
trans-unit.target: Use Azure Notification Hubs with tags in the registration to send breaking news to a universal Windows app.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use Azure Notification Hubs to broadcast breaking news notifications to a Windows Store or Windows Phone 8.1 (non-Silverlight) app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use Azure Notification Hubs to broadcast breaking news notifications to a Windows Store or Windows Phone 8.1 (non-Silverlight) app.

trans-unit.source: If you are targeting Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight, please refer to the <linkText>Windows Phone</linkText><title></title> version.
trans-unit.target: If you are targeting Windows Phone 8.1 Silverlight, please refer to the <linkText>Windows Phone</linkText><title></title> version.

trans-unit.source: When complete, you will be able to register for breaking news categories you are interested in, and receive only push notifications for those categories.
trans-unit.target: When complete, you will be able to register for breaking news categories you are interested in, and receive only push notifications for those categories.

trans-unit.source: This scenario is a common pattern for many apps where notifications have to be sent to groups of users that have previously declared interest in them, e.g. RSS reader, apps for music fans, and so on.
trans-unit.target: This scenario is a common pattern for many apps where notifications have to be sent to groups of users that have previously declared interest in them, e.g. RSS reader, apps for music fans, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Broadcast scenarios are enabled by including one or more tags when creating a registration in the notification hub.
trans-unit.target: Broadcast scenarios are enabled by including one or more tags when creating a registration in the notification hub.

trans-unit.source: When notifications are sent to a tag, all devices that have registered for the tag will receive the notification.
trans-unit.target: When notifications are sent to a tag, all devices that have registered for the tag will receive the notification.

trans-unit.source: Because tags are simply strings, they do not have to be provisioned in advance.
trans-unit.target: Because tags are simply strings, they do not have to be provisioned in advance.

trans-unit.source: For more information about tags, refer to [Notification Hubs Guidance].
trans-unit.target: For more information about tags, refer to [Notification Hubs Guidance].

trans-unit.source: This topic builds on the app you created in <linkText>Get started with Notification Hubs[get-started]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: This topic builds on the app you created in <linkText>Get started with Notification Hubs[get-started]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Before starting this tutorial, you must have already completed <linkText>Get started with Notification Hubs[get-started]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Before starting this tutorial, you must have already completed <linkText>Get started with Notification Hubs[get-started]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The first step is to add the UI elements to your existing main page that enable the user to select categories to register.
trans-unit.target: The first step is to add the UI elements to your existing main page that enable the user to select categories to register.

trans-unit.source: The categories selected by a user are stored on the device.
trans-unit.target: The categories selected by a user are stored on the device.

trans-unit.source: When the app starts, a device registration is created in your notification hub with the selected categories as tags.
trans-unit.target: When the app starts, a device registration is created in your notification hub with the selected categories as tags.

trans-unit.source: Open the MainPage.xaml project file, then copy the following code in the Grid element:
trans-unit.target: Open the MainPage.xaml project file, then copy the following code in the Grid element:

trans-unit.source: Right click the Shared project and add a new class named Notifications, add the public modifier to the class definition, then add the following using statements to the new code file:
trans-unit.target: Right click the Shared project and add a new class named Notifications, add the public modifier to the class definition, then add the following using statements to the new code file:

trans-unit.source: Copy the following code into the new Notifications class:
trans-unit.target: Copy the following code into the new Notifications class:

trans-unit.source: This class uses the local storage to store the categories of news that this device has to receive.
trans-unit.target: This class uses the local storage to store the categories of news that this device has to receive.

trans-unit.source: It also contains methods to register for these categories.
trans-unit.target: It also contains methods to register for these categories.

trans-unit.source: In the App.xaml.cs project file, add the following property to the App class:
trans-unit.target: In the App.xaml.cs project file, add the following property to the App class:

trans-unit.source: This property is used to create and access a Notifications instance.
trans-unit.target: This property is used to create and access a Notifications instance.

trans-unit.source: In the above code, replace the and placeholders with your notification hub name and the connection string for DefaultListenSharedAccessSignature that you obtained earlier.
trans-unit.target: In the above code, replace the and placeholders with your notification hub name and the connection string for DefaultListenSharedAccessSignature that you obtained earlier.

trans-unit.source: Because credentials that are distributed with a client app are not generally secure, you should only distribute the key for listen access with your client app.
trans-unit.target: Because credentials that are distributed with a client app are not generally secure, you should only distribute the key for listen access with your client app.

trans-unit.source: Listen access enables your app to register for notifications, but existing registrations cannot be modified and notifications cannot be sent.
trans-unit.target: Listen access enables your app to register for notifications, but existing registrations cannot be modified and notifications cannot be sent.

trans-unit.source: The full access key is used in a secured backend service for sending notifications and changing existing registrations.
trans-unit.target: The full access key is used in a secured backend service for sending notifications and changing existing registrations.

trans-unit.source: In your MainPage.xaml.cs, add the following line:
trans-unit.target: In your MainPage.xaml.cs, add the following line:

trans-unit.source: In the MainPage.xaml.cs project file, add the following method:
trans-unit.target: In the MainPage.xaml.cs project file, add the following method:

trans-unit.source: This method creates a list of categories and uses the Notifications class to store the list in the local storage and register the corresponding tags with your notification hub.
trans-unit.target: This method creates a list of categories and uses the Notifications class to store the list in the local storage and register the corresponding tags with your notification hub.

trans-unit.source: When categories are changed, the registration is recreated with the new categories.
trans-unit.target: When categories are changed, the registration is recreated with the new categories.

trans-unit.source: Your app is now able to store a set of categories in local storage on the device and register with the notification hub whenever the user changes the selection of categories.
trans-unit.target: Your app is now able to store a set of categories in local storage on the device and register with the notification hub whenever the user changes the selection of categories.

trans-unit.source: These steps register with the notification hub on startup using the categories that have been stored in local storage.
trans-unit.target: These steps register with the notification hub on startup using the categories that have been stored in local storage.

trans-unit.source: Because the channel URI assigned by the Windows Notification Service (WNS) can change at any time, you should register for notifications frequently to avoid notification failures.
trans-unit.target: Because the channel URI assigned by the Windows Notification Service (WNS) can change at any time, you should register for notifications frequently to avoid notification failures.

trans-unit.source: This example registers for notification every time that the app starts.
trans-unit.target: This example registers for notification every time that the app starts.

trans-unit.source: For apps that are run frequently, more than once a day, you can probably skip registration to preserve bandwidth if less than a day has passed since the previous registration.
trans-unit.target: For apps that are run frequently, more than once a day, you can probably skip registration to preserve bandwidth if less than a day has passed since the previous registration.

trans-unit.source: Open the App.xaml.cs file and add the async modifier to OnLaunched method.
trans-unit.target: Open the App.xaml.cs file and add the async modifier to OnLaunched method.

trans-unit.source: In the OnLaunched method, locate and replace the existing call to the InitNotificationsAsync method with the following line of code:
trans-unit.target: In the OnLaunched method, locate and replace the existing call to the InitNotificationsAsync method with the following line of code:

trans-unit.source: This makes sure that every time the app starts it retrieves the categories from local storage and requests a registeration for these categories.
trans-unit.target: This makes sure that every time the app starts it retrieves the categories from local storage and requests a registeration for these categories.

trans-unit.source: The InitNotificationsAsync method was created as part of the [Get started with Notification Hubs] tutorial, but it is not needed in this topic.
trans-unit.target: The InitNotificationsAsync method was created as part of the [Get started with Notification Hubs] tutorial, but it is not needed in this topic.

trans-unit.source: In the MainPage.xaml.cs project file, add the following code to the OnNavigatedTo method:
trans-unit.target: In the MainPage.xaml.cs project file, add the following code to the OnNavigatedTo method:

trans-unit.source: This updates the main page based on the status of previously saved categories.
trans-unit.target: This updates the main page based on the status of previously saved categories.

trans-unit.source: The app is now complete and can store a set of categories in the device local storage used to register with the notification hub whenever the user changes the selection of categories.
trans-unit.target: The app is now complete and can store a set of categories in the device local storage used to register with the notification hub whenever the user changes the selection of categories.

trans-unit.source: Next, we will define a backend that can send category notifications to this app.
trans-unit.target: Next, we will define a backend that can send category notifications to this app.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, press F5 to compile and start the app.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, press F5 to compile and start the app.

trans-unit.source: Note that the app UI provides a set of toggles that lets you choose the categories to subscribe to.
trans-unit.target: Note that the app UI provides a set of toggles that lets you choose the categories to subscribe to.

trans-unit.source: Enable one or more categories toggles, then click Subscribe.
trans-unit.target: Enable one or more categories toggles, then click Subscribe.

trans-unit.source: The app converts the selected categories into tags and requests a new device registration for the selected tags from the notification hub.
trans-unit.target: The app converts the selected categories into tags and requests a new device registration for the selected tags from the notification hub.

trans-unit.source: The registered categories are returned and displayed in a dialog.
trans-unit.target: The registered categories are returned and displayed in a dialog.

trans-unit.source: Send a new notification from the backend in one of the following ways:
trans-unit.target: Send a new notification from the backend in one of the following ways:

trans-unit.source: Console app: start the console app.
trans-unit.target: Console app: start the console app.

trans-unit.source: Java/PHP: run your app/script.
trans-unit.target: Java/PHP: run your app/script.

trans-unit.source: Notifications for the selected categories appear as toast notifications.
trans-unit.target: Notifications for the selected categories appear as toast notifications.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial we learned how to broadcast breaking news by category.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial we learned how to broadcast breaking news by category.

trans-unit.target: This is a good solution for sending notifications only to specific users.
